Instance.description: A scheduling open street director that manages layers and situation schedule.

Tunable.name: churn_alarm_interval
Tunable.description: Number sim minutes to check to make sure shifts and churn are being accurate.

TunableList.name: narrative_object_layers
TunableList.description:
If defined for a narrative, associated conditional layers will be activated while that narrative is active.
The layers should be exclusively owned by the narrative system and should not be toggled on/off by any other means.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: List of conditional layers that should be active while the specified narrative is active.

TunableTuple.name: object_layer_schedule
TunableTuple.description: The default object layer schedule for this open street director, when no season is specified. (e.g. EP05 is not installed, or season not tuned.)

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of schedule entries. Each entry is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

Tunable.name: conditional_layer
Tunable.description: The Conditional Layer that will be loaded.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableList.name: seasonal_object_layer_schedule_mapping
TunableList.description: A mapping of the season type to the object layer schedule for an open street director.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The object layer schedule for this open street director.

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of schedule entries. Each entry is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

Tunable.name: conditional_layer
Tunable.description: The Conditional Layer that will be loaded.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

Tunable.name: set_host_as_active_sim
Tunable.description: If checked then the active Sim will be set as the host of situations started from this director if we do not have a pre-made guest list.

TunableList.name: situation_shifts
TunableList.description: A list of situation distributions and their strictness rules.

TunableList.name: additional_sources
TunableList.description: Any additional sources of NPCs that we want to use to add into the possible situations of this shift curve.

TunableVariant.description: The different additional situation sources that we want to use to get additional situation possibilities that can be chosen.

TunableTuple.name: holiday
TunableTuple.description: Use Situations from the tuned Holiday Walkbys.

TunableTuple.name: narrative
TunableTuple.description: Get situations from active narratives.

TunableTuple.name: zone_modifier
TunableTuple.description: Use Situations from a specific Zone modifier.

Tunable.name: zone_modifier
Tunable.description: The zone modifier that we want to get the

Tunable.name: count_based_on_expected_sims
Tunable.description: If checked then we will count based on the number of Sims that are expected to be in the Situation rather than the number of situations.

TunableTuple.name: curve_based
TunableTuple.description: A situation curve defines the desired amount of certain situations at specific times of the day.

TunableTuple.name: desired_sim_count_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to the desired sim count.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A list of tuples declaring a relationship between days of the week and desire curves.

TunableTuple.description:
The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day.
days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2
By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description:
Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column).
The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen.
Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)]
if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet)
The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

TunableTuple.name: desired_walkby_situations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description:
If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget.
If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableTuple.name: params
TunableTuple.description: Situation creation parameters.

Tunable.name: user_facing
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will start the situation as user facing. Note: We can only have one user facing situation at a time, so make sure you aren't tuning multiple user facing situations to occur at once.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A set of tests that must pass for the situation and weight pair to be available for selection.
*IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableTuple.name: weight_multipliers
TunableTuple.description:
Tunable tested multiplier to apply to weight.
*IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: shiftless
TunableTuple.description: A listed of weighted situations that will be chosen that will not end based of shift change.

TunableTuple.name: _desired_siutations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget.
If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableEnum.name: shift_strictness
TunableEnum.description:
Determine how situations on shift will be handled on shift change.
Example: I want 3 customers between 10-12. then after 12 I want only 1. Having this checked will allow 3 customers to stay and will let situation duration kick the sim out when appropriate. This will not create new situations if over the cap.

TunableList.name: situations_on_load
TunableList.description: Situations that are always started when the zone director loads and are only shut down by the zone director when the zone director shuts down (although they can still end by other means). Because these situations are always restarted, it is invalid to schedule situations with a positive persistence option here (ask a GPE if you need to determine a situation's persistence option).
